creator: paul.carr@express-gifts.co.uk
text:
Batik scales A4 images down slightly meaning that the resulting printout is 
incorrect. I'm working on a project where we need to print to various paper 
sizes accurately( i.e. to stick a persons name into a box on a pre printed 
Certificate) I was determined to use SVG, but this issue is stopping me from 
proceeding.

To reproduce : 
(1)use inkscape to create an A4 portrait image with a 48pt "X" in each corner 
of the page. 
(2)save
(3)open file in squiggle (the top right "X" has already moved to the left)
(4)print file to A4 with zero margins

results:-
the "X" at the top left is correctly positioned
the "X"'s at the bottom have moved up slightly 
the "X" at the top right has moved left slightly

You can actually notice the problem in squiggle before it even comes to 
printing it...the top right "X" is visibly further left.

I also took the latest SVN, same problem, This is very urgent for me, I'd love 
to use batik in this new project and have a couple of days left to give my 
technical recommendations....pls help 

Best Regards
Paul.

creator: paul.carr@express-gifts.co.uk

text:
AFAIK, Batik uses 96 dpi as default resolution. This is important when no
viewBox is used in the SVG files. And that is exactly what happens if you
produce an SVG file using Inkscape. I'd check the screen resolution setting in
your operating system. Normally this is 96 dpi, but in Windows, for example, you
can set the screen resolution to "Large Fonts" which results in a 72dpi
resolution. Maybe that's where the problem comes from. AFAIK, it's not possible
to query the screen resolution from Java.

Maybe that helps...

text:
AHA ... had a bit of a breakthough...Cameron McCormack from the batik mailing 
list sent me some better SVG (in mm), and it made batik display the SVG on 
screen correctly, but when printing it had the same problem. I used inkscape to 
print the same SVG file and it came out perfectly, so I'm now fairly certain 
that there is a bug in the batik PrintTranscoder / printing mechanism. I used 
the java print API before to accurately print A4 jpegs, so I'm ruling that out 
as a bug. It could actually be a bug in Squiggle and nothing to do with batik 
at all ???

I suspect that this is related to the thread:

http://www.nabble.com/Bug-%28-I-think%29-t1075235.html

If so it turns out to be a bug in JDK 1.5 & 1.6.
So unless anyone has a good idea for workaround
(and patch ;) I've marked it as WONTFIX.
